newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICAN POLICE COMPLAINTS UNIT STARTS WORK.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICAN POLICE COMPLAINTS UNIT STARTS WORK.

text.p: The new south African police unit set up to investigate complaints against officers handled 30 cases in its first week, 10 involving deaths in detention, a parliamentary committee heard on Monday.

Independent Complaints Directorate (ICD) chief director Peter Mothle told the parliamentary safety and security committee the complaints were received within eight days after the ICD started operating on April 1.
Of the 30 cases, 11 came from KwaZulu-Natal, eight from Gauteng, six from the Free State, two from the Free State and one each from Northern Province, Mpumalanga and North West Province.
Of the 10 deaths in custody reported, three were in KwaZulu- Natal, two from the Western Cape, two from Gauteng and one each from the Free State, Mpumalanga and North West province.

Mothle described the 15 million rand set aside in the 1997/98 budget for the ICD as "woefully inadequate" and said that it would initially only have offices in Gauteng, the Western Cape and KwaZulu-Natal.
